column9: >Donald Trump said Tuesday he will unveil new tariffs on semiconductors and chips as soon as next week.

column8: We're going to be announcing on semiconductors and chips, which is a separate category, because we want them made in the United States,&quot

column7: >Trump said that that announcement will come &quot
column8: within the next week or so.&quot
column9: He did not provide other details about the plan.

column7: >Global demand for semiconductors and microchips has skyrocketed as the technology has become integrated in virtually all sectors of the economy, including the booming artificial intelligence industry.

>The vast majority of the world's most advanced semiconductors come from Taiwan, home of <a href=""https://www.cnbc.com/2021/03/16/2-charts-show-how-much-the-world-depends-on-taiwan-for-semiconductors.html""><span style="" text-decoration: underline

column7: >Trump revealed the tariff timeline days after he signed an executive order to impose new U.S. duties on a slew of countries' imports, with some trading partners facing steep hikes. Taiwanese goods are set to face an updated tariff of 20% starting this week — though that is down from the 32% duty Trump had previously threatened as part of his April 2 &quot
>Trump's remarks on CNBC on Tuesday morning emphasized that his tariff plans are far from finished.
>He said in the same appearance that tariffs on imported pharmaceuticals could eventually reach up to 250%. He had previously said that those tariffs would top out at 200%.

column7: >The map could net Republicans as many <a href=""https://www.politico.com/news/2025/07/30/new-congressional-texas-map-redistricting-00483086""><span style="" text-decoration: underline
column9: >as five seats in the state. It has triggered an arms race across the country, with Democratic-controlled states —

column7:
>“We have an opportunity in Texas to pick up five seats. We have a really good governor, and we have good people in Texas. And I won Texas,” Trump told CNBC’s Squawk Box. “I got the highest vote in the history of Texas, as you probably know, and we are entitled to five more seats.”
